Acrobatic.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Acrobatics and Fly skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Acrobatic.description: You are skilled at leaping, jumping, and flying.
Acrobatic.name: Acrobatic
Acrobatic.summary: +2 bonus on Acrobatics and Fly checks

Acrobatic Steps.benefit: Whenever you move, you may move through up to 15 feet of difficult terrain each round as if it were normal terrain. The effects of this feat stack with those provided by Nimble Moves (allowing you to move normally through a total of 20 feet of difficult terrain each round).
Acrobatic Steps.description: You can easily move over and through obstacles.
Acrobatic Steps.name: Acrobatic Steps
Acrobatic Steps.summary: Ignore 20 feet of difficult terrain when you move

Agile Maneuvers.benefit: You add your Dexterity bonus to your base attack bonus and size bonus when determining your Combat Maneuver Bonus (see Combat Maneuver Bonus.
Agile Maneuvers.description: You've learned to use your quickness in place of brute force when performing combat maneuvers.
Agile Maneuvers.name: Agile Maneuvers
Agile Maneuvers.summary: Use your Dex bonus when calculating your CMB

Alertness.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Perception and Sense Motive skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Alertness.description: You often notice things that others might miss.
Alertness.name: Alertness
Alertness.summary: +2 bonus on Perception and Sense Motive checks

Alignment Channel.benefit: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of the chosen alignment subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of the chosen alignment subtype, your channel energy has no effect on other creatures. The amount of damage healed or dealt and the DC to halve the damage is otherwise unchanged.
Alignment Channel.description: Choose chaos, evil, good, or law. You can channel divine energy to affect outsiders that possess this subtype.
Alignment Channel.name: Alignment Channel
Alignment Channel.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new alignment subtype. Whenever you channel energy, you must choose which type to effect.
Alignment Channel.summary: Channel energy can heal or harm outsiders

Animal Affinity.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Handle Animal and Ride skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Animal Affinity.description: You are skilled at working with animals and mounts.
Animal Affinity.name: Animal Affinity
Animal Affinity.summary: +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Ride checks

Arcane Armor Mastery.benefit: As a swift action, reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the armor you are wearing by 20% for any spells you cast this round. This bonus replaces, and does not stack with, the bonus granted by Arcane Armor Training.
Arcane Armor Mastery.description: You have mastered the ability to cast spells while wearing armor.
Arcane Armor Mastery.name: Arcane Armor Mastery
Arcane Armor Mastery.summary: Reduce your arcane spell failure chance by 20%

Arcane Armor Training.benefit: As a swift action, reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the armor you are wearing by 10% for any spells you cast this round.
Arcane Armor Training.description: You have learned how to cast spells while wearing armor.
Arcane Armor Training.name: Arcane Armor Training
Arcane Armor Training.summary: Reduce your arcane spell failure chance by 10%

Arcane Strike.benefit: As a swift action, you can imbue your weapons with a fraction of your power. For 1 round, your weapons deal +1 damage and are treated as magic for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. For every five caster levels you possess, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
Arcane Strike.description: You draw upon your arcane power to enhance your weapons with magical energy.
Arcane Strike.name: Arcane Strike
Arcane Strike.summary: +1 damage and weapons are considered magic

Armor Proficiency, Heavy.description: You are skilled at wearing heavy armor.
Armor Proficiency, Heavy.name: Armor Proficiency, Heavy
Armor Proficiency, Heavy.special: Fighters and paladins automatically have Heavy Armor Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.
Armor Proficiency, Heavy.summary: No penalties on attack rolls while wearing heavy armor

Armor Proficiency, Light.benefit: When you wear a type of armor with which you are proficient, the armor check penalty for that armor applies only to Dexterity- and Strength-based skill checks.
Armor Proficiency, Light.description: You are skilled at wearing light armor.
Armor Proficiency, Light.name: Armor Proficiency, Light
Armor Proficiency, Light.normal: A character who is wearing armor with which he is not proficient applies its armor check penalty to attack rolls and to all skill checks that involve moving.
Armor Proficiency, Light.special: All characters except monks, sorcerers, and wizards automatically have Light Armor Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.
Armor Proficiency, Light.summary: No penalties on attack rolls while wearing light armor

Armor Proficiency, Medium.description: You are skilled at wearing medium armor.
Armor Proficiency, Medium.name: Armor Proficiency, Medium
Armor Proficiency, Medium.special: Barbarians, clerics, druids, fighters, paladins, and rangers automatically have Medium Armor Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.
Armor Proficiency, Medium.summary: No penalties on attack rolls while wearing medium armor

Athletic.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Climb and Swim skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Athletic.name: Athletic
Athletic.summary: +2 bonus on Climb and Swim checks

Augment Summoning.benefit: Each creature you conjure with any summon spell gains a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength and Constitution for the duration of the spell that summoned it.
Augment Summoning.description: Your summoned creatures are more powerful and robust.
Augment Summoning.name: Augment Summoning
Augment Summoning.summary: Summoned creatures gain +4 Str and Con

Bleeding Critical.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing or piercing weapon, your opponent takes 2d6 points of bleed damage (see Bleed damage can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal skill check or through any magical healing. The effects of this feat stack.
Bleeding Critical.description: Your critical hits cause opponents to bleed profusely.
Bleeding Critical.name: Bleeding Critical
Bleeding Critical.special: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
Bleeding Critical.summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target takes 2d6 bleed

Blind-Fight.benefit:
In melee, every time you miss because of concealment (see invisible attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee. That is, you don't lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible. The invisible attacker's bonuses do still apply for ranged attacks, however.

You do not need to make Acrobatics skill checks to move at full speed while blinded.
Blind-Fight.description: You are skilled at attacking opponents that you cannot clearly perceive.
Blind-Fight.name: Blind-Fight
Blind-Fight.normal: Regular attack roll modifiers for invisible attackers trying to hit you apply, and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC. The speed reduction for darkness and poor visibility also applies.
Blind-Fight.special: The Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

Blinding Critical.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent is permanently blinded. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to dazzled for 1d4 rounds. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on creatures that do not rely on eyes for sight or creatures with more than two eyes (although multiple critical hits might cause blindness, at the GM's discretion). Blindness can be cured by heal, regeneration, remove blindness, or similar abilities.
Blinding Critical.name: Blinding Critical
Blinding Critical.special: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
Blinding Critical.summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is blinded

Brew Potion.benefit: You can create a potion of any 3rd-level or lower spell that you know and that targets one or more creatures or objects. Brewing a potion takes 2 hours if its base price is 250 gp or less, otherwise brewing a potion takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. When you create a potion, you set the caster level, which must be sufficient to cast the spell in question and no higher than your own level. To brew a potion, you must use up raw materials costing one half this base price. See the magic item creation rules in flat-footed against any attacks you make with an improvised melee weapon.
Brew Potion.name: Brew Potion
Brew Potion.normal: You take a –4 penalty on attack rolls made with an improvised weapon.

Catch Off-Guard.benefit: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised melee weapon. Unarmed opponents are flat-footed against any attacks you make with an improvised melee weapon.
Catch Off-Guard.description: Foes are surprised by your skilled use of unorthodox and improvised weapons.
Catch Off-Guard.name: Catch Off-Guard
Catch Off-Guard.normal: You take a –4 penalty on attack rolls made with an improvised weapon.
Catch Off-Guard.summary: No penalties for improvised melee weapons

Channel Smite.benefit: Before you make a melee attack roll, you can choose to spend one use of your channel energy ability as a swift action. If you channel positive energy and you hit an undead creature, that creature takes an amount of additional damage equal to the damage dealt by your channel positive energy ability. If you channel negative energy and you hit a living creature, that creature takes an amount of additional damage equal to the damage dealt by your channel negative energy ability. Your target can make a Will save, as normal, to halve this additional damage. If your attack misses, the channel energy ability is still expended with no effect.
Channel Smite.description: You can channel your divine energy through a melee weapon you wield.
Channel Smite.name: Channel Smite

Cleave.benefit: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the first and also within reach. You can only make one additional attack per round with this feat. When you use this feat, you take a –2 penalty to your Armor Class until your next turn.
Cleave.description: You can strike two adjacent foes with a single swing.
Cleave.name: Cleave
Cleave.summary: Make an additional attack if the first one hits

Combat Casting.benefit: You get a +4 bonus on concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability when casting on the defensive or while grappled.
Combat Casting.description: You are adept at spellcasting when threatened or distracted.
Combat Casting.name: Combat Casting
Combat Casting.summary: +4 bonus on concentration checks for defensive casting

Combat Expertise.benefit: You can choose to take a –1 penalty on melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Armor Class. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the dodge bonus increases by +1. You can only choose to use this feat when you declare that you are making an attack or a full-attack action with a melee weapon. The effects of this feat last until your next turn.
Combat Expertise.description: You can increase your defense at the expense of your accuracy.
Combat Expertise.name: Combat Expertise
Combat Expertise.summary: Trade attack bonus for AC bonus

Combat Reflexes.benefit: You may make a number of additional attacks of opportunity per round equal to your Dexterity bonus. With this feat, you may also make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.
Combat Reflexes.description: You can make additional attacks of opportunity.
Combat Reflexes.name: Combat Reflexes
Combat Reflexes.normal: A character without this feat can make only one attack of opportunity per round and can't make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.
Combat Reflexes.special: The Combat Reflexes feat does not allow a rogue to use her opportunist ability more than once per round.

Command Undead.benefit: As a standard action, you can use one of your uses of channel negative energy to enslave undead within 30 feet. Undead receive a Will save to negate the effect. The DC for this Will save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your cleric level + your Charisma modifier. Undead that fail their saves fall under your control, obeying your commands to the best of their ability, as if under the effects of control undead. Intelligent undead receive a new saving throw each day to resist your command. You can control any number of undead, so long as their total Hit Dice do not exceed your cleric level. If you use channel energy in this way, it has no other effect (it does not heal or harm nearby creatures). If an undead creature is under the control of another creature, you must make an opposed Charisma check whenever your orders conflict.
Command Undead.description: Using foul powers of necromancy, you can command undead creatures, making them into your servants.
Command Undead.name: Command Undead
Command Undead.summary: Channel energy can be used to control undead

Craft Magic Arms and Armor.benefit: When you score a critical hit, you can apply the effects of two critical feats in addition to the damage dealt.
Craft Magic Arms and Armor.description: You can create magic armor, shields, and weapons.
Craft Magic Arms and Armor.name: Craft Magic Arms and Armor
Craft Magic Arms and Armor.normal: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit in addition to the damage dealt.
Craft Magic Arms and Armor.summary: Create magic armors, shields, and weapons

Craft Rod.benefit: You can create magic rods. Crafting a rod takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a rod, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. See the magic item creation rules in Magic Items for more information.
Craft Rod.name: Craft Rod

Craft Staff.benefit: You can create any staff whose prerequisites you meet. Crafting a staff takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a staff, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. A newly created staff has 10 charges. See the magic item creation rules in Magic Items for more information.
Craft Staff.name: Craft Staff

Craft Wand.benefit: You can create a wand of any 4th-level or lower spell that you know. Crafting a wand takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a wand, you must use up raw materials costing half of this base price. A newly created wand has 50 charges. See the magic item creation rules in Magic Items for more information.
Craft Wand.name: Craft Wand

Craft Wondrous Item.benefit:
You can create a wide variety of magic wondrous items. Crafting a wondrous item takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its price. To create a wondrous item, you must use up raw materials costing half of its base price. See the magic item creation rules in Magic Items for more information.

You can also mend a broken wondrous item if it is one that you could make. Doing so costs half the raw materials and half the time it would take to craft that item.
Craft Wondrous Item.description: You can create wondrous items, a type of magic item.
Craft Wondrous Item.name: Craft Wondrous Item

Critical Focus.benefit: You receive a +4 circumstance bonus on attack rolls made to confirm critical hits.
Critical Focus.description: You are trained in the art of causing pain.
Critical Focus.name: Critical Focus
Critical Focus.summary: +4 bonus on attack rolls made to confirm critical hits

Critical Mastery.benefit: When you score a critical hit, you can apply the effects of two critical feats in addition to the damage dealt.
Critical Mastery.description: Your critical hits cause two additional effects.
Critical Mastery.name: Critical Mastery
Critical Mastery.normal: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit in addition to the damage dealt.
Critical Mastery.summary: Apply two effects to your critical hits

Dazzling Display.benefit: While wielding the weapon in which you have Weapon Focus, you can perform a bewildering show of prowess as a full-round action. Make an Intimidate check to demoralize all foes within 30 feet who can see your display.
Dazzling Display.description: Your skill with your favored weapon can frighten enemies.
Dazzling Display.name: Dazzling Display

Deadly Aim.benefit: You can choose to take a –1 penalty on all ranged attack rolls to gain a +2 bonus on all ranged damage rolls. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2. You must choose to use this feat before making an attack roll and its effects last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to touch attacks or effects that do not deal hit point damage.
Deadly Aim.description: You can make exceptionally deadly ranged attacks by pinpointing a foe's weak spot, at the expense of making the attack less likely to succeed.
Deadly Aim.name: Deadly Aim
Deadly Aim.summary: Trade ranged attack bonus for damage

Deadly Stroke.benefit: As a standard action, make a single attack with the weapon for which you have Greater Weapon Focus against a stunned or flat-footed opponent. If you hit, you deal double the normal damage and the target takes 1 point of Constitution bleed (see bleed is not multiplied on a critical hit.
Deadly Stroke.description: With a well-placed strike, you can bring a swift and painful end to most foes.
Deadly Stroke.name: Deadly Stroke
requires: Greater Weapon Focus, Shatter Defenses, Weapon Focus
Deadly Stroke.summary: Deal double damage plus 1 Con bleed

Deafening Critical.benefit: Whenever you score a critical hit against an opponent, the victim is permanently deafened. A successful Fortitude save reduces the deafness to 1 round. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. This feat has no effect on deaf creatures. This deafness can be cured by heal, regeneration, remove deafness, or a similar ability.
Deafening Critical.description: Your critical hits cause enemies to lose their hearing.
Deafening Critical.name: Deafening Critical
Deafening Critical.special: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
Deafening Critical.summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is deafened

Deceitful.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Bluff and Disguise skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Deceitful.description: You are skilled at deceiving others, both with the spoken word and with physical disguises.
Deceitful.name: Deceitful
Deceitful.summary: +2 bonus on Bluff and Disguise checks

Defensive Combat Training.benefit: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with an attack from a ranged weapon, you may deflect it so that you take no damage from it. You must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. Attempting to deflect a ranged attack doesn't count as an action. Unusually massive ranged weapons (such as boulders or ballista bolts) and ranged attacks generated by natural attacks or spell effects can't be deflected.
Defensive Combat Training.description: You excel at defending yourself from all manner of combat maneuvers.
Defensive Combat Training.name: Defensive Combat Training
Defensive Combat Training.summary: Use your total Hit Dice as your base attack bonus for CMD

Deflect Arrows.benefit: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with an attack from a ranged weapon, you may deflect it so that you take no damage from it. You must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. Attempting to deflect a ranged attack doesn't count as an action. Unusually massive ranged weapons (such as boulders or ballista bolts) and ranged attacks generated by natural attacks or spell effects can't be deflected.
Deflect Arrows.description: You can knock arrows and other projectiles off course, preventing them from hitting you.
Deflect Arrows.name: Deflect Arrows
Deflect Arrows.summary: Avoid one ranged attack per round

Deft Hands.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on Disable Device and Sleight of Hand skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
Deft Hands.name: Deft Hands
Deft Hands.summary: +2 bonus on Disable Device and Sleight of Hand checks

Diehard.benefit:
When your hit point total is below 0, but you are not dead, you automatically stabilize. You do not need to make a Constitution check each round to avoid losing additional hit points. You may choose to act as if you were disabled, rather than dying. You must make this decision as soon as you are reduced to negative hit points (even if it isn't your turn). If you do not choose to act as if you were disabled, you immediately fall unconscious.

When using this feat, you are staggered. You can take a move action without further injuring yourself, but if you perform any standard action (or any other action deemed as strenuous, including some swift actions, such as casting a quickened spell) you take 1 point of damage after completing the act. If your negative hit points are equal to or greater than your Constitution score, you immediately die.
Diehard.description: You are especially hard to kill. Not only do your wounds automatically stabilize when grievously injured, but you can remain conscious and continue to act even at death's door.
Diehard.name: Diehard
Diehard.normal: A character without this feat who is reduced to negative hit points is unconscious and dying.
Diehard.summary: Automatically stabilize and remain conscious below 0 hp

Disruptive.benefit: The DC to cast spells defensively increases by +4 for all enemies that are within your threatened area. This increase to casting spells defensively only applies if you are aware of the enemy's location and are capable of taking an attack of opportunity. If you can only take one attack of opportunity per round and have already used that attack, this increase does not apply.
Disruptive.description: Your training makes it difficult for enemy spellcasters to safely cast spells near you.
Disruptive.name: Disruptive
Disruptive.summary: Increases the DC to cast spells adjacent to you

Dodge.benefit: You gain a +1 dodge bonus to your AC. A condition that makes you lose your Dex bonus to AC also makes you lose the benefits of this feat.
Dodge.description: Your training and reflexes allow you to react swiftly to avoid an opponents' attacks.
Dodge.name: Dodge

Double Slice.benefit: Add your Strength bonus to damage rolls made with your off-hand weapon.
Double Slice.description: Your off-hand weapon while dual-wielding strikes with greater power.
Double Slice.name: Double Slice
Double Slice.normal: You normally add only half of your Strength modifier to damage rolls made with a weapon wielded in your off-hand.
Double Slice.summary: Add your Str bonus to off-hand damage rolls

Elemental Channel.benefit: Instead of its normal effect, you can choose to have your ability to channel energy heal or harm outsiders of your chosen elemental subtype. You must make this choice each time you channel energy. If you choose to heal or harm creatures of your elemental subtype, your channel energy has no effect on other creatures. The amount of damage healed or dealt and the DC to halve the damage is otherwise unchanged.
Elemental Channel.description: Choose one elemental subtype, such as air, earth, fire, or water. You can channel your divine energy to harm or heal outsiders that possess your chosen elemental subtype.
Elemental Channel.name: Elemental Channel
Elemental Channel.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new elemental subtype.
Elemental Channel.summary: Channel energy can harm or heal elementals

Empower Spell.benefit:
All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half, including bonuses to those dice rolls.

Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables. An empowered spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level.
Empower Spell.description: You can increase the power of your spells, causing them to deal more damage.
Empower Spell.name: Empower Spell

Endurance.benefit:
You gain a +4 bonus on the following checks and saves: Swim checks made to resist nonlethal damage from exhaustion; Constitution checks made to continue running; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march; Constitution checks made to hold your breath; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from starvation or thirst; Fortitude saves made to avoid nonlethal damage from hot or cold environments; and Fortitude saves made to resist damage from suffocation.

You may sleep in light or medium armor without becoming fatigued.
Endurance.description: Harsh conditions or long exertions do not easily tire you.
Endurance.name: Endurance
Endurance.normal: A character without this feat who sleeps in medium or heavier armor is fatigued the next day.
Endurance.summary: +4 bonus on checks to avoid nonlethal damage

Enlarge Spell.benefit:
You can alter a spell with a range of close, medium, or long to increase its range by 100%. An enlarged spell with a range of close now has a range of 50 ft. + 5 ft./level, while medium-range spells have a range of 200 ft. + 20 ft./level and long-range spells have a range of 800 ft. + 80 ft./level. An enlarged spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Spells whose ranges are not defined by distance, as well as spells whose ranges are not close, medium, or long, do not benefit from this feat.
Enlarge Spell.description: You can increase the range of your spells.
Enlarge Spell.name: Enlarge Spell

Eschew Materials.benefit: You can cast any spell with a material component costing 1 gp or less without needing that component. The casting of the spell still provokes attacks of opportunity as normal. If the spell requires a material component that costs more than 1 gp, you must have the material component on hand to cast the spell, as normal.
Eschew Materials.description: You can cast many spells without needing to utilize minor material components.
Eschew Materials.name: Eschew Materials

Exhausting Critical.benefit: When you score a critical hit on a foe, your target immediately becomes exhausted. This feat has no effect on exhausted creatures.
Exhausting Critical.description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become exhausted.
Exhausting Critical.name: Exhausting Critical
Exhausting Critical.special: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess the Critical Mastery feat.
Exhausting Critical.summary: Whenever you score a critical hit, the target is exhausted

Exotic Weapon Proficiency.benefit: You make attack rolls with the weapon normally.
Exotic Weapon Proficiency.description: Choose one type of exotic weapon, such as the spiked chain or whip. You understand how to use that type of exotic weapon in combat, and can utilize any special tricks or qualities that exotic weapon might allow.
Exotic Weapon Proficiency.name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency
Exotic Weapon Proficiency.normal: A character who uses a weapon with which he is not proficient takes a –4 penalty on attack rolls.
Exotic Weapon Proficiency.special: You can gain Exotic Weapon Proficiency multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of exotic weapon.
Exotic Weapon Proficiency.summary: No penalty on attacks made with one exotic weapon

Extend Spell.benefit: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of concentration, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat. An extended spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
Extend Spell.description: You can make your spells last twice as long.
Extend Spell.name: Extend Spell

Extra Channel.benefit: You can channel energy two additional times per day.
Extra Channel.description: You can channel divine energy more often.
Extra Channel.name: Extra Channel
Extra Channel.special: If a paladin with the ability to channel positive energy takes this feat, she can use lay on hands four additional times a day, but only to channel positive energy.
Extra Channel.summary: Channel energy two additional times per day

Extra Ki.description: You can use your ki pool more times per day than most.
Extra Ki.name: Extra Ki
Extra Ki.special: You can gain Extra Ki multiple times. Its effects stack.
Extra Ki.summary: Increase your ki pool by 2 points

Extra Lay On Hands.benefit: You can use your lay on hands ability two additional times per day.
Extra Lay On Hands.description: You can use your lay on hands ability more often.
Extra Lay On Hands.name: Extra Lay On Hands
Extra Lay On Hands.special: You can gain Extra Lay On Hands multiple times. Its effects stack.
Extra Lay On Hands.summary: Use lay on hands two additional times per day

Extra Mercy.benefit: Select one additional mercy for which you qualify. When you use lay on hands to heal damage to one target, it also receives the additional effects of this mercy.
Extra Mercy.description: Your lay on hands ability adds an additional mercy.
Extra Mercy.name: Extra Mercy
Extra Mercy.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, select a new mercy.
Extra Mercy.summary: Your lay on hands benefits from one additional mercy

Extra Performance.benefit: You can use bardic performance for 6 additional rounds per day.
Extra Performance.description: You can use your bardic performance ability more often than normal.
Extra Performance.name: Extra Performance
Extra Performance.special: You can gain Extra Performance multiple times. Its effects stack.
Extra Performance.summary: Use bardic performance for 6 additional rounds per day

Extra Rage.benefit: You can rage for 6 additional rounds per day.
Extra Rage.description: You can use your rage ability more than normal.
Extra Rage.name: Extra Rage
Extra Rage.special: You can gain Extra Rage multiple times. Its effects stack.
Extra Rage.summary: Use rage for 6 additional rounds per day

Far Shot.benefit: You only suffer a –1 penalty per full range increment between you and your target when using a ranged weapon.
Far Shot.description: You are more accurate at longer ranges.
Far Shot.name: Far Shot
Far Shot.normal: You suffer a –2 penalty per full range increment between you and your target.

Fleet.benefit: While you are wearing light or no armor, your base speed increases by 5 feet. You lose the benefits of this feat if you carry a medium or heavy load.
Fleet.name: Fleet
Fleet.special: You can take this feat multiple times. The effects stack.
Fleet.summary: Your base speed increases by 5 feet

Forge Ring.benefit: As a standard action, make a single unarmed melee attack against a foe whose speed is reduced (such as from Scorpion Style). If the attack hits, you deal damage normally and the target is staggered until the end of your next turn unless it makes a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier). This feat has no effect on targets that are staggered.
Forge Ring.name: Forge Ring

Gorgon's Fist.benefit: As a standard action, make a single unarmed melee attack against a foe whose speed is reduced (such as from Scorpion Style). If the attack hits, you deal damage normally and the target is staggered until the end of your next turn unless it makes a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier). This feat has no effect on targets that are staggered.
Gorgon's Fist.description: With one well-placed blow, you leave your target reeling.
Gorgon's Fist.name: Gorgon's Fist
Gorgon's Fist.summary: Stagger a foe whose speed is reduced

Great Cleave.benefit: As a standard action, you can make a single attack at your full base attack bonus against a foe within reach. If you hit, you deal damage normally and can make an additional attack (using your full base attack bonus) against a foe that is adjacent to the previous foe and also within reach. If you hit, you can continue to make attacks against foes adjacent to the previous foe, so long as they are within your reach. You cannot attack an individual foe more than once during this attack action. When you use this feat, you take a –2 penalty to your Armor Class until your next turn.
Great Cleave.description: You can strike many adjacent foes with a single blow.
Great Cleave.name: Great Cleave
Great Cleave.summary: Make an additional attack after each attack hits

Great Fortitude.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.
Great Fortitude.description: You are resistant to poisons, diseases, and other maladies.
Great Fortitude.name: Great Fortitude

Greater Bull Rush.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Bull Rush. Whenever you bull rush an opponent, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
Greater Bull Rush.description: Your bull rush attacks throw enemies off balance.
Greater Bull Rush.name: Greater Bull Rush
Greater Bull Rush.normal: Creatures moved by bull rush do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Greater Bull Rush.summary: Enemies you bull rush provoke attacks of opportunity

Greater Disarm.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Disarm. Whenever you successfully disarm an opponent, the weapon lands 15 feet away from its previous wielder, in a random direction.
Greater Disarm.description: You can knock weapons far from an enemy's grasp.
Greater Disarm.name: Greater Disarm
Greater Disarm.normal: Disarmed weapons and gear land at the feet of the disarmed creature.
Greater Disarm.summary: Disarmed weapons are knocked away from your enemy

Greater Feint.benefit: Whenever you use feint to cause an opponent to lose his Dexterity bonus, he loses that bonus until the beginning of your next turn, in addition to losing his Dexterity bonus against your next attack.
Greater Feint.description: You are skilled at making foes overreact to your attacks.
Greater Feint.name: Greater Feint
Greater Feint.normal: A creature you feint loses its Dexterity bonus against your next attack.
Greater Feint.summary: Enemies you feint lose their Dex bonus for 1 round

Greater Grapple.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Grapple. Once you have grappled a creature, maintaining the grapple is a move action. This feat allows you to make two grapple checks each round (to move, harm, or pin your opponent), but you are not required to make two checks. You only need to succeed at one of these checks to maintain the grapple.
Greater Grapple.description: Maintaining a grapple is second nature to you.
Greater Grapple.name: Greater Grapple
Greater Grapple.normal: Maintaining a grapple is a standard action.
Greater Grapple.summary: Maintain your grapple as a move action

Greater Overrun.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Overrun. Whenever you overrun opponents, they provoke attacks of opportunity if they are knocked prone by your overrun.
Greater Overrun.description: Enemies must dive to avoid your dangerous move.
Greater Overrun.name: Greater Overrun
Greater Overrun.normal: Creatures knocked prone by your overrun do not provoke an attack of opportunity.
Greater Overrun.summary: Enemies you overrun provoke attacks of opportunity

Greater Penetrating Strike.benefit: Your attacks with weapons selected with Weapon Focus ignore up to 10 points of damage reduction. This amount is reduced to 5 points for damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/—).
Greater Penetrating Strike.description: Your attacks penetrate the defenses of most foes.
Greater Penetrating Strike.name: Greater Penetrating Strike
Greater Penetrating Strike.summary: Your attacks ignore 10 points of damage reduction

Greater Shield Focus.benefit: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Shield Focus.
Greater Shield Focus.description: You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.
Greater Shield Focus.name: Greater Shield Focus
Greater Shield Focus.summary: Gain a +1 bonus to your AC when using a shield

Greater Spell Focus.benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.
Greater Spell Focus.description: Choose a school of magic to which you have already applied the Spell Focus feat. Any spells you cast of this school are very hard to resist.
Greater Spell Focus.name: Greater Spell Focus
Greater Spell Focus.special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school to which you already have applied the Spell Focus feat.
Greater Spell Focus.summary: +1 bonus on save DCs for one school

Greater Spell Penetration.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance. This bonus stacks with the one from Spell Penetration.
Greater Spell Penetration.description: Your spells break through spell resistance much more easily than most.
Greater Spell Penetration.name: Greater Spell Penetration
Greater Spell Penetration.summary: +2 bonus on level checks to beat spell resistance

Greater Sunder.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Sunder. Whenever you sunder to destroy a weapon, shield, or suit of armor, any excess damage is applied to the item's wielder. No damage is transferred if you decide to leave the item with 1 hit point.
Greater Sunder.description: Your devastating strikes cleave through weapons and armor and into their wielders, damaging both item and wielder alike in a single terrific strike.
Greater Sunder.name: Greater Sunder
Greater Sunder.summary: Damage from sunder attempts transfers to your enemy

Greater Trip.benefit: You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Trip. Whenever you successfully trip an opponent, that opponent provokes attacks of opportunity.
Greater Trip.description: You can make free attacks on foes that you knock down.
Greater Trip.name: Greater Trip
Greater Trip.normal: Creatures do not provoke attacks of opportunity from being tripped.
Greater Trip.summary: Enemies you trip provoke attacks of opportunity

Greater Two-Weapon Fighting.benefit: You get a third attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a –10 penalty.
Greater Two-Weapon Fighting.description: You are incredibly skilled at fighting with two weapons at the same time.
Greater Two-Weapon Fighting.name: Greater Two-Weapon Fighting

Greater Vital Strike.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including those from Weapon Focus.
Greater Vital Strike.description: You can make a single attack that deals incredible damage.
Greater Vital Strike.name: Greater Vital Strike
Greater Vital Strike.special: You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
Greater Vital Strike.summary: Deal four times the normal damage on a single attack

Greater Weapon Focus.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including those from Weapon Focus.
Greater Weapon Focus.description: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus. You are a master at your chosen weapon.
Greater Weapon Focus.name: Greater Weapon Focus
Greater Weapon Focus.special: You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
Greater Weapon Focus.summary: +1 bonus on attack rolls with one weapon

Greater Weapon Specialization.benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus to damage stacks with other damage roll bonuses, including any you gain from Weapon Specialization.
Greater Weapon Specialization.description: Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you possess the Weapon Specialization feat. Your attacks with the chosen weapon are more devastating than normal.
Greater Weapon Specialization.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
requires: Greater Weapon Focus with selected weapon
Greater Weapon Specialization.special: You can gain Greater Weapon Specialization multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
Greater Weapon Specialization.summary: +2 bonus on damage rolls with one weapon

Heighten Spell.benefit: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal (up to a maximum of 9th level). Unlike other metamagic feats, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies. All effects dependent on spell level (such as saving throw DCs and ability to penetrate a lesser globe of invulnerability) are calculated according to the heightened level. The heightened spell is as difficult to prepare and cast as a spell of its effective level.
Heighten Spell.description: You can cast spells as if they were a higher level.
Heighten Spell.name: Heighten Spell
Heighten Spell.summary: Treat spell as a higher level

Improved Bull Rush.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to bull rush a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to bull rush you.
Improved Bull Rush.description: You are skilled at pushing your foes around.
Improved Bull Rush.name: Improved Bull Rush
Improved Bull Rush.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a bull rush combat maneuver.
Improved Bull Rush.summary: +2 bonus on bull rush attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Channel.benefit: Add 2 to the DC of saving throws made to resist the effects of your channel energy ability.
Improved Channel.description: Your channeled energy is harder to resist.
Improved Channel.name: Improved Channel

Improved Counterspell.benefit: When counterspelling, you may use a spell of the same school that is one or more spell levels higher than the target spell.
Improved Counterspell.description: You are skilled at countering the spells of others using similar spells.
Improved Counterspell.name: Improved Counterspell
Improved Counterspell.normal: Without this feat, you may counter a spell only with the same spell or with a spell specifically designated as countering the target spell.
Improved Counterspell.summary: Counterspell with spell of the same school

Improved Critical.benefit: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.
Improved Critical.description: Attacks made with your chosen weapon are quite deadly.
Improved Critical.name: Improved Critical
Improved Critical.special:
You can gain Improved Critical multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

This effect doesn't stack with any other effect that expands the threat range of a weapon.
Improved Critical.summary: Double the threat range of one weapon

Improved Disarm.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to disarm a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to disarm you.
Improved Disarm.description: You are skilled at knocking weapons from a foe's grasp.
Improved Disarm.name: Improved Disarm
Improved Disarm.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a disarm combat maneuver.
Improved Disarm.summary: +2 bonus on disarm attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Familiar.benefit:
When choosing a familiar, the creatures listed below are also available to you. You may choose a familiar with an alignment up to one step away on each alignment axis (lawful through chaotic, good through evil).

FamiliarAlignmentArcane Spellcaster Level
Celestial hawk1Neutral good3rd
Dire ratNeutral3rd
Fiendish viper2Neutral evil3rd
Elemental, Small (any type)Neutral5th
StirgeNeutral5th
Homunculus3Any7th
ImpLawful evil7th
Mephit (any type)Neutral7th
PseudodragonNeutral good7th
QuasitChaotic evil7th
1 Or other celestial animal from the standard familiar list.
2 Or other fiendish animal from the standard familiar list.
3 The master must first create the homunculus.

Improved familiars otherwise use the rules for regular familiars, with two exceptions: if the creature's type is something other than animal, its type does not change; and improved familiars do not gain the ability to speak with other creatures of their kind (although many of them already have the ability to communicate).
Improved Familiar.description: This feat allows you to acquire a powerful familiar, but only when you could normally acquire a new familiar.
Improved Familiar.name: Improved Familiar
requires: Ability to acquire a new familiar

Improved Feint.benefit: You can make a Bluff check to feint in combat as a move action.
Improved Feint.description: You are skilled at fooling your opponents in combat.
Improved Feint.name: Improved Feint
Improved Feint.normal: Feinting in combat is a standard action.

Improved Grapple.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to grapple you.
Improved Grapple.name: Improved Grapple
Improved Grapple.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver.
Improved Grapple.summary: +2 bonus on grapple attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Great Fortitude.benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a Fortitude save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Improved Great Fortitude.description: You can draw upon an inner reserve to resist diseases, poisons, and other grievous harm.
Improved Great Fortitude.name: Improved Great Fortitude
Improved Great Fortitude.summary: Once per day, you may reroll a Fortitude save

Improved Initiative.benefit: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.
Improved Initiative.description: Your quick reflexes allow you to react rapidly to danger.
Improved Initiative.name: Improved Initiative

Improved Iron Will.benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Improved Iron Will.description: Your clarity of thought allows you to resist mental attacks.
Improved Iron Will.name: Improved Iron Will
Improved Iron Will.summary: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save

Improved Lightning Reflexes.benefit: Once per day, you may reroll a Reflex save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Improved Lightning Reflexes.description: You have a knack for avoiding danger all around you.
Improved Lightning Reflexes.name: Improved Lightning Reflexes
Improved Lightning Reflexes.summary: Once per day, you may reroll a Reflex save

Improved Overrun.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to overrun you. Targets of your overrun attempt may not chose to avoid you.
Improved Overrun.description: You are skilled at running down your foes.
Improved Overrun.name: Improved Overrun
Improved Overrun.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing an overrun combat maneuver.
Improved Overrun.summary: +2 bonus on overrun attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Precise Shot.benefit: Your ranged attacks ignore the AC bonus granted to targets by anything less than total cover, and the miss chance granted to targets by anything less than total concealment. Total cover and total concealment provide their normal benefits against your ranged attacks.
Improved Precise Shot.description: Your ranged attacks ignore anything but total concealment and cover.
Improved Precise Shot.name: Improved Precise Shot
Improved Precise Shot.normal: See the normal rules on the effects of cover and concealment in Combat.
Improved Precise Shot.summary: No cover or concealment chance on ranged attacks

Improved Shield Bash.benefit: When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield's shield bonus to your AC.
Improved Shield Bash.name: Improved Shield Bash
Improved Shield Bash.normal: Without this feat, a character that performs a shield bash loses the shield's shield bonus to AC until his next turn (see Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1.
Improved Shield Bash.summary: Keep your shield bonus when shield bashing

Improved Sunder.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to sunder your gear.
Improved Sunder.name: Improved Sunder
Improved Sunder.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver.
Improved Sunder.summary: +2 bonus on sunder attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Trip.benefit: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to trip you.
Improved Trip.description: You are skilled at sending your opponents to the ground.
Improved Trip.name: Improved Trip
Improved Trip.normal: You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver.
Improved Trip.summary: +2 bonus on trip attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Two-Weapon Fighting.benefit: In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a –5 penalty.
Improved Two-Weapon Fighting.description: You are skilled at fighting with two weapons.
Improved Two-Weapon Fighting.name: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
Improved Two-Weapon Fighting.normal: Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.

Improved Unarmed Strike.benefit: You are considered to be armed even when unarmed—you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when you attack foes while unarmed. Your unarmed strikes can deal lethal or nonlethal damage, at your choice.
Improved Unarmed Strike.description: You are skilled at fighting while unarmed.
Improved Unarmed Strike.name: Improved Unarmed Strike
Improved Unarmed Strike.normal: Without this feat, you are considered unarmed when attacking with an unarmed strike, and you can deal only nonlethal damage with such an attack.

Improved Vital Strike.benefit: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised weapon. Increase the amount of damage dealt by the improvised weapon by one step (for example, 1d4 becomes 1d6) to a maximum of 1d8 (2d6 if the improvised weapon is two-handed). The improvised weapon has a critical threat range of 19–20, with a critical multiplier of ×2.
Improved Vital Strike.description: You can make a single attack that deals a large amount of damage.
Improved Vital Strike.name: Improved Vital Strike
Improved Vital Strike.summary: Deal three times the normal damage on a single attack

Improvised Weapon Mastery.benefit: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised weapon. Increase the amount of damage dealt by the improvised weapon by one step (for example, 1d4 becomes 1d6) to a maximum of 1d8 (2d6 if the improvised weapon is two-handed). The improvised weapon has a critical threat range of 19–20, with a critical multiplier of ×2.
Improvised Weapon Mastery.description: You can turn nearly any object into a deadly weapon, from a razor-sharp chair leg to a sack of flour.
Improvised Weapon Mastery.name: Improvised Weapon Mastery

Intimidating Prowess.benefit: Add your Strength modifier to Intimidate skill checks in addition to your Charisma modifier.
Intimidating Prowess.description: Your physical might is intimidating to others.
Intimidating Prowess.name: Intimidating Prowess
Intimidating Prowess.summary: Add Str to Intimidate in addition to Cha

Iron Will.benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Will saving throws.
Iron Will.description: You are more resistant to mental effects.
Iron Will.name: Iron Will

Leadership.benefit:
This feat enables you to attract a loyal cohort and a number of devoted subordinates who assist you. A cohort is generally an NPC with class levels, while followers are typically lower level NPCs. See Table: Leadership for what level of cohort and how many followers you can recruit.

Leadership Modifiers: Several factors can affect your Leadership score, causing it to vary from the base score (character level + Cha modifier). Your reputation (from the point of view of the cohort or follower you are trying to attract) raises or lowers your Leadership score:

Leader's ReputationModifier
Great renown+2
Fairness and generosity+1
Special power+1

Cruelty–2

Other modifiers may apply when you try to attract a cohort, as listed below.

Has a familiar, special mount, or animal companion–2
Recruits a cohort of a different alignment–1
Caused the death of a cohort–2*
* Cumulative per cohort killed.

Followers have different priorities from cohorts. When you try to attract a follower, use the following modifiers.


The Leader... Modifier
Has a stronghold, base of operations, guildhouse, etc.+2
Moves around a lot–1
Caused the death of other followers–1

Leadership Score: Your base Leadership score equals your level plus your Charisma modifier. In order to take into account negative Charisma modifiers, this table allows for very low Leadership scores, but you must still be 7th level or higher in order to gain the Leadership feat. Outside factors can affect your Leadership score, as detailed above.

Cohort Level: You can attract a cohort of up to this level. Regardless of your Leadership score, you can only recruit a cohort who is two or more levels lower than yourself. The cohort should be equipped with gear appropriate for its level (see Reflex saving throws.
